pr_title: PLANNER-1840 Extra test coverage for joiners

timeline.bodyText: Code style: I think that * imports are generally less preferable. Is it intentional here or is it an accident caused by IDE?
timeline.author: rsynek

timeline.bodyText:
This presumes that that we'll never do this:
Bi<A,B>.join(Bi<C,D>)
I don't want to close off that opportunity.
-1 to abstract the Right generatic type here...
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: You can probably use f::apply (one less wrapper lambda)
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: Not in this case. It would work if I was trying to get rid of f, but here I need to pass a to f and therefore I need to do it like this.
replies.author: triceo

timeline.message:
Revert "Refactor joiners for code reuse"

This reverts commit 32771ff7
